abstract: Citigroup and Goldman Sachs will invest a total of $52 million in software firm ICSA of India, the company said on Wednesday. Citigroup would pay $30 million for a 14 percent stake, which will be made up of new shares and 284,000 convertible warrants. Goldman would buy $22 million of foreign currency convertible bonds.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup and Goldman Sachs will invest a total of $52 million in software firm ICSA of India, the company said on Wednesday. Citigroup would pay $30 million for a 14 percent stake, which will be made up of new shares and 284,000 convertible warrants. Goldman would buy $22 million of foreign currency convertible bonds.

headline.main: Citigroup and Goldman Invest in Indian Software Firm
